ASSESSMENTS.title: Learner Self-reflection – 24355 (v3)
ASSESSMENTS.subtitle: Demonstrate knowledge of construction and manufacturing materials used in BCATS projects

questions.text: What is the most common exotic timber that is grown in plantations in New Zealand?
questions.hint: See Exotic Softwoods – which plantation timber covers large areas of both islands? (Page 13)

questions.text: Name 2 types of New Zealand native timbers that can be used for high-quality furniture.
questions.hint: See Indigenous timbers (native) – look for the three timbers linked to high-quality or recycled furniture. (Pages 12–13)

questions.text: Name an imported timber that can be used for decking and outdoor furniture.
questions.hint: Look under Imported Hardwoods – which one is listed for decking and outdoor furniture? (Page 14)

questions.text: List 3 types of timber that are commonly used for woodturning.
questions.hint: See Indigenous timbers – one is specifically prized for woodturning; others are commonly used too. (Pages 12–13)

questions.text: Describe the effects of moisture on MDF.
questions.hint: See MDF disadvantages – focus on the ‘when wet’ and ‘over time’ sections if not sealed. (Page 18)

questions.text: Name a lightweight expanded plastic that is used for insulation in houses as well as for buoyancy in boats.
questions.hint: See the Plastics section – look for the lightweight, buoyant foam used in construction and boats. (Page 22)

questions.text: Name a commonly used metal that can be easily joined by welding.
questions.hint: See Ferrous metals – which common metal is widely used in construction and easily welded? (Page 20)

questions.text: List 2 materials that could be used for the walls of a dog kennel.
questions.hint: Think of common exterior-grade sheet or cladding materials suitable for outdoor structures. (Pages 17–19)

questions.text: List a hard, transparent material that can be manufactured to be noise-resistant, flat or curved, polished or textured surface and even bulletproof.
questions.hint: See clear thermoplastics – which one is tough and used for safety screens? (Page 24)

questions.text: Name the plastic sheet material that is commonly used as a waterproof membrane under concrete.
questions.hint: Look under construction plastics – what sheet is used as a DPM? (Page 23)

questions.text: What are the 3 main materials that make up concrete?
questions.hint: See Concrete section – list the three core components. (Page 25)

questions.text: What is the function of a primer coat when painting?
questions.hint: See Paint section – what does primer do for adhesion, sealing, and protection? (Page 26)

rubric.check: better adhesion|improves adhesion|helps paint adhere|helps paint stick|adhesion of paint|paint sticks better|good bond|better bond
increases durability|more durable|paint lasts longer|durability|longer lasting
preparatory coating|preparatory|prepares the surface|prepares surface|for first coat|undercoat

questions.text: Identify 3 methods that are commonly used to apply a paint finish.
questions.hint: Look in the Paint application section for the three main methods. (Page 26)

questions.text: Name 2 types of polishes and state the advantage that polish has over oil finishes.
questions.hint: See Polishes – name two types and compare durability to oil. (Page 28)

questions.text: Name 2 types of varnishes, briefly stating an advantage of each one.
questions.hint: See Varnish section – note the two types and their key benefits (drying, durability, etc.). (Page 27)
